react-sidemenu

Lightweight side menu component written in React.js. No jQuery, just CSS3.

  • Pure React.js, no external dependencies
  • Configure with JSON or via React components
  • Packed with default ready-to-use styling
  • Easy to customize styling guide
  • Support of custom properties
  • Detailed documentation
  • Examples

Base example

  • JSON structure
  • React Components structure

  import React from 'react';
  import SideMenu from 'react-sidemenu';
  import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

  const items = [
  	{divider: true, label: 'Main navigation', value: 'main-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 1', value: 'item1', icon: 'fa-search',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 1.1', value: 'item1.1', icon: 'fa-snapchat',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 1.1.1', value: 'item1.1.1', icon: 'fa-anchor'},
  			{label: 'item 1.1.2', value: 'item1.1.2', icon: 'fa-bar-chart'}]},
  		{label: 'item 1.2', value: 'item1.2'}]},
  	{label: 'item 2', value: 'item2', icon: 'fa-automobile',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 2.1', value: 'item2.1',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 2.1.1', value: 'item2.1.1'},
  			{label: 'item 2.1.2', value: 'item2.1.2'}]},
  		{label: 'item 2.2', value: 'item2.2'}]},
  	{divider: true, label: 'Motors', value: 'motors-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 3', value: 'item3', icon: 'fa-beer'}
  ];

  let Example1 = React.createClass({
  	render: function() {
  		return (
<div>
  				<SideMenu items={items}/>
  			</div>
  		)
  	}
  });

  ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-1'));
			      

	import React from 'react';
	import {SideMenu, Item} from 'react-sidemenu';
	import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

	let Example2 = React.createClass({
		render: function() {
			return (
			<div>
	      <SideMenu>
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 1" value="segment1"/>
	        <Item label="Item 1" icon="fa-search">
	          <Item label="Item 1.1" value="item1.1" icon="fa-snapchat">
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.1" value="item1.1.1" icon="fa-anchor"/>
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.2" value="item1.1.2" icon="fa-bar-chart"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 1.2" value="item1.2"/>
	        </Item>
	        <Item label="Item 2" value="item2" icon="fa-automobile">
	          <Item label="Item 2.1" value="item2.1.1">
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.1" value="item2.1.1"/>
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.2" value="item2.1.2"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 2.2" value="item2.2"/>
	        </Item>
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 2" value="segment2"/>
		<Item label="Item 3" value="item3" icon="fa-beer"/>
	      </SideMenu>
		</div>
			)
		}
	});

	ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-2'));

No collapse example

  • JSON structure
  • React Components structure

  import React from 'react';
  import SideMenu from 'react-sidemenu';
  import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

  const items = [
  	{divider: true, label: 'Main navigation', value: 'main-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 1', value: 'item1', icon: 'fa-search',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 1.1', value: 'item1.1', icon: 'fa-snapchat',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 1.1.1', value: 'item1.1.1', icon: 'fa-anchor'},
  			{label: 'item 1.1.2', value: 'item1.1.2', icon: 'fa-bar-chart'}]},
  		{label: 'item 1.2', value: 'item1.2'}]},
  	{label: 'item 2', value: 'item2', icon: 'fa-automobile',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 2.1', value: 'item2.1',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 2.1.1', value: 'item2.1.1'},
  			{label: 'item 2.1.2', value: 'item2.1.2'}]},
  		{label: 'item 2.2', value: 'item2.2'}]},
  	{divider: true, label: 'Motors', value: 'motors-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 3', value: 'item3', icon: 'fa-beer'}
  ];

  let Example1 = React.createClass({
  	render: function() {
  		return (
<div>
  				<SideMenu items={items} collapse={false}/>
  			</div>
  		)
  	}
  });

  ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-1'));
			      

	import React from 'react';
	import {SideMenu, Item} from 'react-sidemenu';
	import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

	let Example2 = React.createClass({
		render: function() {
			return (
			<div>
	      <SideMenu collapse={false}>
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 1" value="segment1"/>
	        <Item label="Item 1" icon="fa-search">
	          <Item label="Item 1.1" value="item1.1" icon="fa-snapchat">
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.1" value="item1.1.1" icon="fa-anchor"/>
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.2" value="item1.1.2" icon="fa-bar-chart"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 1.2" value="item1.2"/>
	        </Item>
	        <Item label="Item 2" value="item2" icon="fa-automobile">
	          <Item label="Item 2.1" value="item2.1.1">
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.1" value="item2.1.1"/>
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.2" value="item2.1.2"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 2.2" value="item2.2"/>
	        </Item>
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 2" value="segment2"/>
		<Item label="Item 3" value="item3" icon="fa-beer"/>
	      </SideMenu>
		</div>
			)
		}
	});

	ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-2'));

Custom rendering example

  • JSON structure
  • React Components structure

  import React from 'react';
  import SideMenu from 'react-sidemenu';
  import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

  const items = [
  	{divider: true, label: 'Main navigation', value: 'main-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 1', value: 'item1', icon: 'fa-search',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 1.1', value: 'item1.1', icon: 'fa-snapchat',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 1.1.1', value: 'item1.1.1', icon: 'fa-anchor'},
  			{label: 'item 1.1.2', value: 'item1.1.2', icon: 'fa-bar-chart'}]},
  		{label: 'item 1.2', value: 'item1.2'}]},
  	{label: 'item 2', value: 'item2', icon: 'fa-automobile',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 2.1', value: 'item2.1',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 2.1.1', value: 'item2.1.1'},
  			{label: 'item 2.1.2', value: 'item2.1.2'}]},
  		{label: 'item 2.2', value: 'item2.2'}]},
  	{divider: true, label: 'Motors', value: 'motors-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 3', value: 'item3', icon: 'fa-beer'}
  ];

  let Example1 = React.createClass({
  	render: function() {
  		return (
			<div>
  		<SideMenu items={items}
			renderMenuItemContent={(item) => (<span><strong style={{color: "red"}}>{item.label}</strong></span>)} />
  		</div>
  		)
  	}
  });

  ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-1'));
			      

	import React from 'react';
	import {SideMenu, Item} from 'react-sidemenu';
	import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

	let Example2 = React.createClass({
		render: function() {
			return (
			<div>
	      <SideMenu renderMenuItemContent={(item) => (<span><strong style={{color: "red"}}>{item.label}</strong></span>)}>
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 1" value="segment1"/>
	        <Item label="Item 1" icon="fa-search">
	          <Item label="Item 1.1" value="item1.1" icon="fa-snapchat">
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.1" value="item1.1.1" icon="fa-anchor"/>
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.2" value="item1.1.2" icon="fa-bar-chart"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 1.2" value="item1.2"/>
	        </Item>
	        <Item label="Item 2" value="item2" icon="fa-automobile">
	          <Item label="Item 2.1" value="item2.1.1">
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.1" value="item2.1.1"/>
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.2" value="item2.1.2"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 2.2" value="item2.2"/>
	        </Item>
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 2" value="segment2"/>
		<Item label="Item 3" value="item3" icon="fa-beer"/>
	      </SideMenu>
		</div>
			)
		}
	});

	ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-2'));

Custom click example

  • JSON structure
  • React Components structure

	import React from 'react';
  import SideMenu from 'react-sidemenu';
  import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

  const items = [
  	{divider: true, label: 'Main navigation', value: 'main-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 1', value: 'item1', icon: 'fa-search',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 1.1', value: 'item1.1', icon: 'fa-snapchat',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 1.1.1', value: 'item1.1.1', icon: 'fa-anchor'},
  			{label: 'item 1.1.2', value: 'item1.1.2', icon: 'fa-bar-chart'}]},
  		{label: 'item 1.2', value: 'item1.2'}]},
  	{label: 'item 2', value: 'item2', icon: 'fa-automobile',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 2.1', value: 'item2.1',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 2.1.1', value: 'item2.1.1'},
  			{label: 'item 2.1.2', value: 'item2.1.2'}]},
  		{label: 'item 2.2', value: 'item2.2'}]},
  	{divider: true, label: 'Motors', value: 'motors-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 3', value: 'item3', icon: 'fa-beer'}
  ];

  let Example1 = React.createClass({
  	render: function() {
  		return (
			<div>
  		<SideMenu items={items}
			onMenuItemClick={(value) => alert("You just clicked me: ${value}")} />
  		</div>
  		)
  	}
  });

  ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-1'));
			      

	import React from 'react';
	import {SideMenu, Item} from 'react-sidemenu';
	import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

	let Example2 = React.createClass({
		render: function() {
			return (
			<div>
	      <SideMenu onMenuItemClick={(value) => alert("You just clicked me: ${value}")} >
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 1" value="segment1"/>
	        <Item label="Item 1" icon="fa-search">
	          <Item label="Item 1.1" value="item1.1" icon="fa-snapchat">
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.1" value="item1.1.1" icon="fa-anchor"/>
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.2" value="item1.1.2" icon="fa-bar-chart"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 1.2" value="item1.2"/>
	        </Item>
	        <Item label="Item 2" value="item2" icon="fa-automobile">
	          <Item label="Item 2.1" value="item2.1.1">
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.1" value="item2.1.1"/>
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.2" value="item2.1.2"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 2.2" value="item2.2"/>
	        </Item>
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 2" value="segment2"/>
		<Item label="Item 3" value="item3" icon="fa-beer"/>
	      </SideMenu>
		</div>
			)
		}
	});

	ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-2'));

Custom theme example

  • JSON structure
  • React Components structure
  • Custom template less

  import React from 'react';
  import SideMenu from 'react-sidemenu';
  import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

  const items = [
  	{divider: true, label: 'Main navigation', value: 'main-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 1', value: 'item1', icon: 'fa-search',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 1.1', value: 'item1.1', icon: 'fa-snapchat',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 1.1.1', value: 'item1.1.1', icon: 'fa-anchor'},
  			{label: 'item 1.1.2', value: 'item1.1.2', icon: 'fa-bar-chart'}]},
  		{label: 'item 1.2', value: 'item1.2'}]},
  	{label: 'item 2', value: 'item2', icon: 'fa-automobile',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 2.1', value: 'item2.1',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 2.1.1', value: 'item2.1.1'},
  			{label: 'item 2.1.2', value: 'item2.1.2'}]},
  		{label: 'item 2.2', value: 'item2.2'}]},
  	{divider: true, label: 'Motors', value: 'motors-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 3', value: 'item3', icon: 'fa-beer'}
  ];

  let Example1 = React.createClass({
  	render: function() {
  		return (
			<div>
  		<SideMenu items={items} theme='custom' />
  		</div>
  		)
  	}
  });

  ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-1'));
			      

	import React from 'react';
	import {SideMenu, Item} from 'react-sidemenu';
	import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

	let Example2 = React.createClass({
		render: function() {
			return (
			<div>
	      <SideMenu theme='custom' >
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 1" value="segment1"/>
	        <Item label="Item 1" icon="fa-search">
	          <Item label="Item 1.1" value="item1.1" icon="fa-snapchat">
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.1" value="item1.1.1" icon="fa-anchor"/>
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.2" value="item1.1.2" icon="fa-bar-chart"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 1.2" value="item1.2"/>
	        </Item>
	        <Item label="Item 2" value="item2" icon="fa-automobile">
	          <Item label="Item 2.1" value="item2.1.1">
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.1" value="item2.1.1"/>
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.2" value="item2.1.2"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 2.2" value="item2.2"/>
	        </Item>
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 2" value="segment2"/>
		<Item label="Item 3" value="item3" icon="fa-beer"/>
	      </SideMenu>
		</div>
			)
		}
	});

	ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-2'));
	      

	.Side-menu-custom {
	  .divider {
	    background-color: #ABABAB;
	    font-weight: 600;
	  }

	  .item {
	    background-color: #CCC;

	    &.item-level-1 .item-label {
	      font-style: italic;
	    }

	    &.item-level-2 .item-label {
	      font-size: 10px;
	    }
	  }
	}

Active item exmple

  • JSON structure
  • React Components structure

  import React from 'react';
  import SideMenu from 'react-sidemenu';
  import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

  const items = [
  	{divider: true, label: 'Main navigation', value: 'main-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 1', value: 'item1', icon: 'fa-search',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 1.1', value: 'item1.1', icon: 'fa-snapchat',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 1.1.1', value: 'item1.1.1', icon: 'fa-anchor'},
  			{label: 'item 1.1.2', value: 'item1.1.2', icon: 'fa-bar-chart'}]},
  		{label: 'item 1.2', value: 'item1.2'}]},
  	{label: 'item 2', value: 'item2', icon: 'fa-automobile',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 2.1', value: 'item2.1',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 2.1.1', value: 'item2.1.1'},
  			{label: 'item 2.1.2', value: 'item2.1.2'}]},
  		{label: 'item 2.2', value: 'item2.2'}]},
  	{divider: true, label: 'Motors', value: 'motors-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 3', value: 'item3', icon: 'fa-beer'}
  ];

  let ExampleActive = React.createClass({
  	render: function() {
  		return (
			<div>
  		<SideMenu items={items} activeItem="item1.1" />
  		</div>
  		)
  	}
  });

  ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-1'));
			      

	import React from 'react';
	import {SideMenu, Item} from 'react-sidemenu';
	import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

	let Example2 = React.createClass({
		render: function() {
			return (
			<div>
	      <SideMenu activeItem="item1.1" >
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 1" value="segment1"/>
	        <Item label="Item 1" icon="fa-search">
	          <Item label="Item 1.1" value="item1.1" icon="fa-snapchat">
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.1" value="item1.1.1" icon="fa-anchor"/>
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.2" value="item1.1.2" icon="fa-bar-chart"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 1.2" value="item1.2"/>
	        </Item>
	        <Item label="Item 2" value="item2" icon="fa-automobile">
	          <Item label="Item 2.1" value="item2.1.1">
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.1" value="item2.1.1"/>
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.2" value="item2.1.2"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 2.2" value="item2.2"/>
	        </Item>
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 2" value="segment2"/>
		<Item label="Item 3" value="item3" icon="fa-beer"/>
	      </SideMenu>
		</div>
			)
		}
	});

	ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-2'));

RTL example

  • JSON structure
  • React Components structure

  import React from 'react';
  import SideMenu from 'react-sidemenu';
  import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

  const items = [
  	{divider: true, label: 'Main navigation', value: 'main-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 1', value: 'item1', icon: 'fa-search',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 1.1', value: 'item1.1', icon: 'fa-snapchat',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 1.1.1', value: 'item1.1.1', icon: 'fa-anchor'},
  			{label: 'item 1.1.2', value: 'item1.1.2', icon: 'fa-bar-chart'}]},
  		{label: 'item 1.2', value: 'item1.2'}]},
  	{label: 'item 2', value: 'item2', icon: 'fa-automobile',
  	children: [
  		{label: 'item 2.1', value: 'item2.1',
  		children: [
  			{label: 'item 2.1.1', value: 'item2.1.1'},
  			{label: 'item 2.1.2', value: 'item2.1.2'}]},
  		{label: 'item 2.2', value: 'item2.2'}]},
  	{divider: true, label: 'Motors', value: 'motors-nav'},
  	{label: 'item 3', value: 'item3', icon: 'fa-beer'}
  ];

  let Example1 = React.createClass({
  	render: function() {
  		return (
			<div>
  		<SideMenu items={items} rtl={true} />
  		</div>
  		)
  	}
  });

  ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-1'));
			      

	import React from 'react';
	import {SideMenu, Item} from 'react-sidemenu';
	import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';

	let Example2 = React.createClass({
		render: function() {
			return (
			<div>
	      <SideMenu rtl={true} >
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 1" value="segment1"/>
	        <Item label="Item 1" icon="fa-search">
	          <Item label="Item 1.1" value="item1.1" icon="fa-snapchat">
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.1" value="item1.1.1" icon="fa-anchor"/>
	            <Item label="Item 1.1.2" value="item1.1.2" icon="fa-bar-chart"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 1.2" value="item1.2"/>
	        </Item>
	        <Item label="Item 2" value="item2" icon="fa-automobile">
	          <Item label="Item 2.1" value="item2.1.1">
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.1" value="item2.1.1"/>
	            <Item label="Item 2.1.2" value="item2.1.2"/>
	          </Item>
	          <Item label="Item 2.2" value="item2.2"/>
	        </Item>
		<Item divider={true} label="Segment 2" value="segment2"/>
		<Item label="Item 3" value="item3" icon="fa-beer"/>
	      </SideMenu>
		</div>
			)
		}
	});

	ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('example-2'));
